snippet: The surviving Woolworth houses in Glen Cove and Manhattan exist today in different states of grace; some are single-family homes, and one has been chopped into smaller co-ops.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column on stately houses in Glen Cove, Long Island, and Manhattan that were once owned by five-and-dime store mogul Frank Winfield Woolworth; surviving Woolworth houses are in various states of grace; some are single-family homes and one has been chopped into smaller co-op apartments.
lead_paragraph: The surviving Woolworth houses in Glen Cove and Manhattan exist today in different states of grace; some are single-family homes, and one has been chopped into smaller co-ops.

headline.seo: Woolworth’s Homes, Still Standing in Glen Cove and Manhattan
headline.main: Stately Homes of a Five-and-Dime Store Founder
headline.print_headline: His Discount Stores Are Gone, but Not His Lavish Homes
